website_summaries.verdict: If you want a good deal on an Instant Pot, the Lux 6-in-1 V3 is the way to go. But the Crock-Pot Express is better for novice cooks.
pros: The Instant Pot Lux 6-in-1 V3 cooks food quickly under pressure, low and slow, and also steams and sautes
Its stainless steel pot sears meat and creates deep flavors
cons: Cooked rice tends to stick to its steel pot
And you have to experiment with certain recipes to find the right cook times

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this product works better than expected. worked for 3 months then would not seal or build pressure. Very unhappy with this purchase the instant pot people sent a replacement valve stem. What am is supposed to do with that? Not happy with the 1 year warranty. It basically does not exist. I had to send many e-mails and made numerous phone calls to get them to do anything. So they finally did nothing. very unhappy with the warranty on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Not the best product
customer_reviews.text: This is no better than a crock pot. Yes it does a lot more in one pot but not worth the weight and size. It can not be used on your counter if there are cabinets above or the steam will ruin the finish. VERY loud whistle on pressure cook setting. Plus a big one IT WAS MISSING THE BOTTOM OF THE POT. The wires and computer board were exposed. I did not notice until I went to put it back in the box. FYI Instant pot did not seem the least bit concerned.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: I'm so cheap it's not even funny. My crockpot broke
customer_reviews.text: Buy it. I'm serious. I'm so cheap it's not even funny. My crockpot broke, so I decided to try this as it was the same price as a large crockpot. I regret NOTHING. I can make rice in minutes Eggs have never been easier to peel Bone broth doesn't take DAYS IT EVEN MAKES CHEESECAKE.
customer_reviews.author: SlashnYaoi

customer_reviews.title: Not working properly. Takes over 30 minutes to reach ...
customer_reviews.text: Not working properly. Takes over 30 minutes to reach pressure. liquids are evaporating inside leaving burnt foods and sauces inside. Contacted manufacturer, but no response after 4 days. Slow cooker function works, but I could buy one of those for much cheaper. Frustrated and will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Perdue

customer_reviews.title: All Hype not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Even following the recipes down to the letter, we didn't get the desired results. It didn't seal like it was supposed to so sometimes we didn't have steam at the end. After I saw one of these exploded and burned a child,I knew I had to get it out of my house.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Who needs a kitchen anymore?
customer_reviews.text: To say that I love my instapot is an understatement. I've had it for only two weeks and I swear I haven't touched my stove or pans. So easy to use and so many functions. You can sauté meat, make hardboiled eggs, perfect rice and beans, steam vegetables in a matter of minutes. The instapot community is large and there are always recipes to be shared. So simple to use and clean. I've made anything from perfectly hard boiled eggs whose shells just fall off on their own, to soups, mongolian beef and spaghetti! I am so glad I jumped in the instant pot bandwagon and cannot wait to purchase accessories in the future to make cheesecake and other things.
customer_reviews.author: yestfl

customer_reviews.title: Love my Instant Pot. Works great., plus a awesome cleaning tip
customer_reviews.text: Love my Instant Pot LUX60 V3 6 Qt 6-in-1. Works great. Cleanup is usually very easy and can put pot in the dishwasher, but this happened to me....I scorched pork roast with BBQ sauce stuck on the bottom after cooking too long. But, found a Super easy cleaning tip from the internet that works!! Directions: Pour in 4 cups water. Add 1/4 cup baking soda. Stir together. Put on lid, then turn on Manual (High Pressure) & set for 5 mins.....then do quick release, pour out water mixture, quick wash and rinse out. It’s super clean & looks brand new. AMAZING tip!
customer_reviews.author: Cindi

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: You want a device that’s a complete mystery look no further. Q.Is it on? A.Who knows. Q.Why doesn’t it seal? A.Because its junk. Q.Will my food come out ok? A.It’s a mystery. Q. How about online help? A.Good luck with that. Q.Is it up to pressure ? A.Who knows. Q.Would you recommend it to a friend? A. Only if I no longer wanted to be friends
customer_reviews.author: Kmeith

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I used this item twice and got a C6 error. Followed directions exactly and it is dead. This product was delivered 31 days ago. I am now unable to return this item as it is outside of the return window. Do not buy one of these units. I spent $80 to make French dips once and corned beef which by the way did not finish cooking because all of the lights went on and I got a C6 error before it was done. I am hoping Amazon can make this right as this is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: c.thelemann.

customer_reviews.title: Amazed on the fast yummy meals
customer_reviews.text: Love love love; a friend said she wasn't sure she had room for it I suggested she throw everything else out! Meals made in minutes 😜 Curried chicken 25 minutes; meat fell off the bones
customer_reviews.author: jnudeb

customer_reviews.title: I made jambalaya in it for the first time and I can’t beleive how fun it was making this
customer_reviews.text: Revolutionary! I am cooking ALL of my meals in this from now on! There is such a huge resource for instant pot recipes, it’s silly NOT to get one. I made jambalaya in it for the first time and I can’t beleive how fun it was making this. And so idiot proof!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer for the lazy - me
customer_reviews.text: I don't cook. I'm a frozen pizza and cereal guy. I love good food, I just can't be bothered to spend the prep time and cooking time. So for me this thing is a game changer. Raw chicken to my face - 10 minutes. Frozen bricks of chicken - time to face: 15 minutes. Perfect hard boiled eggs - that peel easy! - 6 minutes. I've only had it a few days (after someone I met wouldn't stop going on about it - I asked what it was too) and it hasn't left me wanting. It lives up to the hype (:
customer_reviews.author: zac thomas

customer_reviews.title: You never know if/when it’s working
customer_reviews.text: This needs to have better alert features on the actual machine and then way better directions. I wasted so much time on so many meals that were supposed to be so quick and then i would have to guess if they were done after waiting forever. Spoiler alert, they never were. And yes the steam hole was closed.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnna Favali

customer_reviews.title: Not What I'd Hoped For...
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd give healthier eating a try, but after my brand-spanking new Instant Pot took an hour to cook cauliflower (and it still wasn't done), I figured this was God's way of telling me to stick to fast food. Returned the IP to Amazon and headed to Culver's.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: We used the product 5 or 6 times and loved it very much
customer_reviews.text: We used the product 5 or 6 times and loved it very much, until the valve FELL OFF all of a sudden, after a regular gentle cleaning (only used a sponge and running water) of the cover. How dangerous it could be should it drop while cooking?! We've used a pressure cooker of another brand in the past 5 years, no problem at all. So am really disappointed with Instant Pot!!! Before writing this review, I also noticed other reviewers mention the various problems of the valve (either missing or pouring out), can someone from the Instant Pot company explain why is there such a safety issue? Is it of this specific model or all other Instant Pot products?
customer_reviews.author: AQ

customer_reviews.title: I thought I would never use anything like this. Love it
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would never use anything like this. Love it. Made a 13lb turkey breast yesterday in 35 min. Moist and perfect.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gee

customer_reviews.title: Idk how such great reviews but did not work for me and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to get a replacement because the water test failed immediately steam continued to come out of the floating valve did not seal. The replacement did not work either continued to have steam coming out. Idk how such great reviews but did not work for me and I ensured to follow all the steps even called instant pot to ensure I wasn’t missing anything. They said I didn’t need a floating valve cap that this certain model didn’t require that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.text: My extended family has no bought three of these. We use the pot for both family meals and cooking for church events (up to 350 people.) We push out pots probably harder than is "usual usage." After eighteen months' aggregate use, I offer the following: The Instant Pot just works! So far, there isn't anything that we've tried that the Instant Pot has disappointed us. It's safe to use, rock-solid reliable operation, super easy to cook with, easy to clean, delivers reliable food results,...Highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Perry

customer_reviews.title: Made St. Louis style ribs first time around and enjoyed fall of the bone, delicious ribs in under 45 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. Will I cook every meal in this? Probably not. Will I cook every meal in this when I have about thirty minutes to prepare a full meal? ABSOLUTELY!!! Made St. Louis style ribs first time around and enjoyed fall of the bone, delicious ribs in under 45 minutes. (Would have easily spent 3 hours on the grill or in the oven.) Love the versatility. You can sautee, steam, or pressure cook all in one vessel. Super easy clean up. Would recommend Instant Pot cookbooks available here on Amazon to get a hang of it but really it has a very short learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: hank

customer_reviews.title: Would like to return, but past my return window.
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good the first few times I used it. Now all the steams escapes. And I'm past the "return window" so I'm stuck with something I can't use.
customer_reviews.author: lisa hooper

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous pressure valve design—causing serious burn!
customer_reviews.text: The pressure valve on the lid is a bad design-it has no lock-down feature to prevent unintentional opening during pressure cooking. Steam shoots up caused serious burn on chef’s arm. Not safe!
customer_reviews.author: theysky

customer_reviews.title: I really like the instapot
customer_reviews.text: I really like the instapot. This is not the more expensive one that has the yogurt function, which is ok with me. When you look at cookbooks or recipes online they always reference the more expensive one, so some of the options are different. It still works the same though. The one thing I do not like about it, is that it is somewhat difficult to clean. Especially when the steam is released and liquid comes out the top. I hate cleaning the lid. Otherwise, I like how easy it is to use.
customer_reviews.author: KimTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Faillure to Comunicate
customer_reviews.text: I was cooking braised short ribs. I seared the beef and all was fine until I needed to lower the temperature to medium before adding the vegetables. I couldn't get the temperature to move from the Hot position so I called customer service for help. What I got was infomercial messages; at least 4 of them before I decided to hang up. Since I didn't get any help I cleaned the item up and immediately returned it. I don't think infomercials should be considered as customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Anna T.

customer_reviews.title: Broken Seal after Second Use
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Instant Pot earlier this year, excited to use it. Thus far, we've used it twice. The first time, we took it out of the box, cleaned it, read the directions carefully, and then cooked a delicious pork shoulder with pineapple. We returned it to the box and stored it in our cabinets. Now, I've pulled it out to make another meal, and the knob that controls the seal is broken. The valve is not working, and we cannot use it to pressure cook. This is only our *second* use! We were not handling it or moving it frequently. If this is the quality of this product, it's not worth purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed. There are crumbs on the inside and what ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received my instant pot. I’ve been patiently wating and excited to use for my family. If I wanted a used one I would have paid for a used one. It has food stuck to it and the inside of it smells of broth. So disappointed. There are crumbs on the inside and what looks like to be dog hair. I’m grossed out. My complaint was how I received this not on function. This is my second time trying to order.
customer_reviews.author: Dalaina

customer_reviews.title: Their customer support is terrible!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Christmas and when I went to use it there was no power. I contacted Instant Pot Support and have yet to hear from them. Their customer support is terrible!!!!!!!!!!! Don't ever buy and Instant Pot
customer_reviews.author: Kabu662

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT NOW, thank me later!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, if you are reading these reviews on the IP you need to just stop and order it. Forget all of the hooplah you have heard about scary pressure cookers from your Mother's youth and just buy it already! This is not your Grandmothers pressure cooker! It's easy to use and easy to clean, just do yourself a favor and buy a separate gasket for sweet items and keep one for savory because after it rocks out to making your chili you so don't want your cheesecake smelling like cumin!
customer_reviews.author: Boonee

customer_reviews.title: GET ONE!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is amazing. So easy to operate and the food is great. I have made several dishes and have convinced family members to buy one. There are hundreds of recipes and step by step instructions on YouTube for beginners. Many of the recipes are dump and go which make meal prep so easy. We have enjoyed pulled chicken bbq, ribs, cheesy pasta, lentil curry, chicken marsala, Mississippi pot roast, beef stew, chicken fried rice, Mongolian chicken, etc. All tasty, all requested again. Definitely would recommend getting one.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy O.

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for a pressure cooker user
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a traditional pressure cooker since many years and am used to that cooking. I decided to buy Instant Pot this Thanks Giving but decided to return after a few days. I missed the simplicity of simple pressure cooker. There were many modes and it was hard to find the right time for the dishes that I cook on regular basis. I found that this product has far too many choices for my taste. I realized that I am not looking to replace my cooking gas and pressure cookers. This product is more suitable for people who dont want to spend too much time in cooking and dont use many utensils to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Hercule

customer_reviews.title: Best cooking gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I had a regular pressure cooker but it broke when I dropped the lid so I researched this one. I am very pleased with its versatility and it is SILENT which is amazing. I had it three times a week at least. Bur a cookbook with it so you can get even more uses out of it. Like you can make pumpkin pie steel cut oats.....yum! There's just so many things you can make, and I don't eat meat but use it for grains, Pasta, Soups, beans. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: EarlenesTrueReviews

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic toy and we do use it, but don't expect it to save you very much time.
customer_reviews.text: InstaPot advertising seems to primarily focus on the device's ability to save you time cooking and cleaning up afterward. The problem is that it really doesn't do that, generally speaking. Yes, you can cook chicken, etc. very quickly. But most recipes (even those in the accompanying booklet) require you to cook things separately due to the nature of how the IP cooks (for example, the chicken, the sauce, and rice or vegetables must be cooked separately) and, in many cases, require at least 1 pot or pan and at least 1 bowl. So it ultimately only shaves 1 or 2 minutes off cook times and results in the same amount of cleanup, or more.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: no floating valve
customer_reviews.text: Is it me or am I the only one who noticed that it doesn’t come with the floating valve thing in the back where you do the pressure release it doesn’t have one watch before you purchase this make sure it comes with it
customer_reviews.author: Ly

customer_reviews.title: Not as fast as a stovetop cooker, but it's super easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: It's not quite as fast as my older Mantra stovetop pressure cooker, but it's basically foolproof as long as you remember to put the seal in. (Yes, it's easy to forget the seal, no need to ask me how I know...) I especially love that I don't even have to thaw out the meat, which is good since I tend to forget to do that. Now I just need to find more recipes to make in it that aren't chicken. We're beef people, and sometimes pork people, but not chicken people. Unless we're desperate. Note: This model only has "high" pressure, but I'm not sure what you would ever use the low pressure for, so I haven't missed it.
customer_reviews.author: SewRusty

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any kitchen. Trust me. You need it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best kitchen item I've ever purchased. Use it almost every day. From sweet tea, to 5lbs roasts, to one pot pasta meals, and the best darn beer brats you'll ever have. If you dont have Pinterest you'll want one for these recipes...It has saved my life cooking after work, especially during this pregnancy when it's really hard for me to stand on the kitchen tile for too long by 530pm... and my husband uses it now too after thinking that " we didn't need it"... now he jokingly complains about me not buying one 2 years ago when we moved in together. Don't be afraid of it! The IP is your FRIEND!!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Kitchen Appliance
customer_reviews.text: This is my new, favorite appliance. So far, I've made soups, stews and sauces. I don't recommend using it to make rice -- I've tried a few times and it just doesn't come out right, so I'm sticking to my Tatung rice cooker. However, everything else I've made has been fantastic. We are a busy family and as a full time working mom, the Instant Pot allows me to easily make delicious, quick and healthy dinners for my family.
customer_reviews.author: B. Yang

customer_reviews.title: Not like our original InstaPot
customer_reviews.text: We loved our first InstaPot, gave it to a friend and ordered this on... it is a bit different and not as easy to use. 1. The front Bean button is not there. Have to punch in time. 2. No water condensation collector... the drips make a big mess all around the top. Hard to clean. 3. The cord does not retract like our original pot. We just received this one and have used it once. May send back.
customer_reviews.author: Patty B.

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality, convenience
customer_reviews.text: I used it to cook rice, make soup, make porrige and to steam stuff. It is really convenient especially with its keep warm function. I usually start cooking before I go to class and let it cook itself. When I come back, I can eat right away. It saves a lot of time. When you make rice in there, it's better to soak it for a while before you clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Xitong Tan

customer_reviews.title: Best Value!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best electric pressure cooker. I have an XL brand also and gave our daughter a Cuisinart brand. The Instant Pot is better quality and has a stainless steel insert, which the others don’t. I’m using the XL brand at our lake place and it works fine. However, the IP was $20 cheaper than the others thanks to an Amazon one day sale.
customer_reviews.author: MsJongg

customer_reviews.title: It's a must have in the kitchen!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my Instant Pot! This is my first time owning one and I'm blown away by the things it can do. Just bought a new stove in March and now I'm not sure I'll have a need for one anymore lol my husband loves that the Instant Pot has given me my freedom to cook back. I have moderate RA and being able to stand and cook long periods is extremely difficult, with the IP I can cook entire meals in under and minutes rather than hours. This makes both of us so happy! He's really missed my cooking and I've missed doing it!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend this for everyone who likes to cook, and even those who don't.
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is for any and all recipes you have to account for the warm up time. It may only add like 5 minutes, but if you have multiple items could add 15 minutes or more. After that this a much loved kitchen tool. It replaces my steamer and slowcooker and adds the feature of a pressure cooker. Since you can saute in it, it saves time and less pots and pans to wash. The learning curve is greater then the slow cooker, but by your second meal you're a cooking champ.
customer_reviews.author: Tsikusr

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of the same item that I continued to use for two years. Unfortunately, I had to sell it to someone before I moved across the state two months ago because I did not have enough space in my moving box. I am happy I finally got a replacement. This new one has some good improvements -- the sealing/venting handle that is easier to use and cord attachment part easier to access.
customer_reviews.author: msk

customer_reviews.title: So far i have loved my Instant Pot for the most part
customer_reviews.text: So far i have loved my Instant Pot for the most part. My only real complaints are that the pressure release valve is so easy to forget. You would think this would be a feature they could somehow attach a sensor to let you know you’be forgotten to reset the pressure valve once the machine kicks to “ON”. Similarly, i don’t understand why they can’t make that switch (the pressure release valve) automatic. Once your food is done, the option you chose before your machine switched to “OK” (slow release option or speedy release) should just happen.
customer_reviews.author: Kyrsten Chisholm

customer_reviews.title: Fun on a bun
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Cooked 2 frozen chicken breast with 1 cup salsa verde and garlic. Delicious and juicy in 15 minutes (plus ten to let the pressure dissipate)! Used a fork to pull into chunks and made burritos. It is easy to use and clean. I'm even planning to buy some accessories for it so I can try lava cakes and cheesecake. I can't wait to try steel cut oats and a batch of black beans. I've already mastered rice. This is perfect for anyone who doesn't want to heat up the whole kitchen, or wash a ton of pots and pans.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great the frist time making soup
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this machine 2 times. Worked great the frist time making soup. The second time making rice the machine seized shut and will not open. I releaved pressure via the valve and have had it unplugged for two weeks. It is still locked shut.
customer_reviews.author: Johannah Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Bummed about the handle
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize that Instant Pot has two different handle designs. When I ordered this one I didn't even think to look at the design. The handle is like a pocket that you slide your hand inside and it's facing the steam valve. This is the second IP I've purchased, the first one had the traditional arching handle, which is a far superior design, in my opinion. I'm older and my hands are losing their squeezing ability to tightly grip and turn a handle like this one. I really dislike it but didn't want to hassle with sending it back. Otherwise, it's a good appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Beth from Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Men- Use This!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot cook, I constantly make messes and my food tastes sub-par, so I bought this as I heard it can cook food easily, which is what I needed. This thing is perfect! I literally throw things in a pot, set the time, and boom! its done. My kitchen stays clean, and the food is cooked just right. Now every week my girlfriend and I experiment with new ingredients, and create some master pieces! along with some nasty stuff too! Overall I highly recommend this product as it makes cooking quick, easy, and enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Used maybe 10 times and it quit working. Guess I've got another slow cooker that I don't need.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Donley

customer_reviews.title: It is great until out of warranty
customer_reviews.text: First off when this works it is a fantastic cooking tool. I really love it. I had purchased a cheap knock off first then purchased this one and I thought it was worth the money since it cooked better than the other one. I was happy with it and would have give it a 5 star until what happened about three months after the warranty was off. I got the C6 error message which means one of the sensors died. For a device this expensive to fail after 1yr 3 months really isn't worth the money. The cheap knock off is still working. If I buy one again, I am going somewhere with an extended warranty plan.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonflame2045

customer_reviews.title: Like this pot
customer_reviews.text: Update....after about 6 months the top started intermittantly locking shut and I would not be able to open without banging on it or prying it. Finally got something different. Would not get again I use pressure cookers several times a week. WE run a dog rescue and we supplement the dogs' diets with cooked foods. This work really well and I hope it lasts a long time. Cleaning: The inner pot cleans VERY easily...it is the outer pot which picks up liquid while cooking and that is a bit harder to clean. So far so good. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Sybil E.

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since sliced meat!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. We are hotpot proselytizers and hope to convince anyone who loves to cook to have one. As slight food snobs... We traveled for 8 months, toddler and cat in tow, and almost solely used this to cook wholesome, gourmet meals. Venison stew, squash/golden beat chili with pork loin, turkey bone in breast for Thanksgiving, a multitude of gluten free pastas, chicken soup from scratch... on and on in hotel rooms, campsites, air bnb’s... anywhere we accessed an electrical receptacle. Solid pot. Held up to being jostled around in a packed car for months. Second one was a replacement since we passed on the first.
customer_reviews.author: My Best Friend Burt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product-Great Lid/Handle Design + Rice & Ladle Spoons Included! :}
customer_reviews.text: I bought another brand before buying this Instant Pot as a replacement for the former broken lid, and I am super happy that I chose this brand. The lid design is genius-it allows for a firm grip to open/close the lid (after depressurizing the pot). Also, it came with rice and liquid spoons, in addition to a small (rice) measuring cup. I am very pleased with this product and intend to use it for many meals to come :}
customer_reviews.author: Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Makes making dinner quickly possible, especially things that would ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes making dinner quickly possible, especially things that would take all day in a slow cooker or would take longer in the oven. I cooked stew meat in 30 minutes that was fork tender/falling apart. Cooked butternut squash for 15-20 minutes and was able to puree into an incredibly smooth soup. Collard greens for Thanksgiving, took 20 minutes. We are loving this and can't wait to try more recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Ebiel and Erica Camacho

customer_reviews.title: Don't Tell My 8 Quart IP This...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I bought an 8-qt. Instant Pot over the holidays and fell in love with it. Then we bought a lake home and I quickly realized I really missed my IP while I was at the lake. Solution? A 6-qt. IP! I didn't realize how much more I would like the 6-qt! The lid is improved, the pressure release is improved and it holds a lot! Guess I need to spend more time at the lake.
customer_reviews.author: TLF

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I only gave this 4 stars because like most of you know, it's not easy to use or understand at first. The instructions it comes with suck. But...now that I know how to use it, thanks to YouTube videos, this is the BOMB! I saute, steam, etc. everything in this. Best flavor compared to a regular crockpot. A pressure cooker keeps the flavor, and cuts the time. A steak stew would take 8-10 hours on low, but this took 1 hour and 15 minutes!!! AND tasted awesome. Honestly at first I was going to return it, but now that I know how to use it...its amazing.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Be careful in purchasing this item since it is not 15 PSI but only works at ~11 PSI. Most pressure cooker recipes assume 15 PSI.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Present!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought me this Instant Pot for my birthday and I absolutely love it! I got the 6 Qt. 6-in-1 cooker and haven't gone more than a few days without using it! Our favorite thing to make in it is chicken breasts because they come out so juicy! I highly recommend this to everyone, especially families that don't necessarily have time in the evenings to make super elaborate meals. We've made countless meals in our pot; chili, chicken, soups, sauteed veggies, rice and so much more!
customer_reviews.author: MistyGenovese

customer_reviews.title: Bought a 6 quart and absolutely love it. Have made ribs
customer_reviews.text: This pot changed my life. Am 66 and was so tired of cooking I could scream. Well along came the electric pressure cooker. I first bought another brand from Costco and returned it after reading about the Instant Pot having a stainless steel inner pot. Bought a 6 quart and absolutely love it. Have made ribs,applesauce,corn bread.roast and now will do yogurt. This will be bigger than the microwave. It has turned out to be the best selling item for Amazon in all of 2016. Wow!!
customer_reviews.author: jan schirmeister

customer_reviews.title: No fear pressure cooking! So fast!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Instant Pot. Someone needs to make a complete recipe book for it. Great quality. Love the solid sound it makes opening and closing the lid. Only complaint is mine doesn't seem to count down when using the timer and is a bit confusing. I always wait until a half hour before dinner to figure out what to cook. This has been a lifesaver to get a one pot meal on the table in record time.
customer_reviews.author: APOHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: amazing. I can't believe how fast it cooks and ...
customer_reviews.text: We've been using Instapot for months now. No durability problems. It cooks everything so well, so fast, and less mess. You can make any dish in it. We named ours R2D2 because he's become integral to our family! LOL. Somehow leftovers cooked in the Instapot taste better too.
customer_reviews.author: prevkasamy

customer_reviews.title: Greatest new appliance ever.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this appliance. Cleanup is a breeze! Great recipes on line with a downlaodable free app which gives searchable recipes and how to's. I recieved this 3 days ago. I have cooked eggplant chili, hard cooked and soft cooked perfect eggs, pheasant with mushrooms and multi-grains, ham and beans with frozen sliced ham and dried beans (35 minutes cooking time). Amazing. Healthy cooking in a fraction of time. I work full time. No need to spend time in the morning preparing everything for the crockpot. Only problem, it doesn't chop the veggies for you. 😊 I am going to free up some space and donate my appliances I no longer will use.
customer_reviews.author: Myta

customer_reviews.title: Love the Instant Pot!
customer_reviews.text: I love the instant pot. I received a larger one as a gift and it’s one of my favorite gifts ever. I use it to make quick and easy meals for my family of 5. I bought this size as a gift for family if 3. They haven’t used it get because they think it’s complicated to use. I explained it is not at all complicated. In fact the instant pot has made cooking so much easier for me at home. However, when I use the one at our vacation home in the mountains, it gets a little tricky. The cooking times must be adjusted for altitude and I find it takes longer to cook right.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Best Kitchen Purchase EVER
customer_reviews.text: Very good for making authentic Indian food. Set your pressure-cooker to saute setting first to melt some ghee, then add flat cinnamon like these, along with whole black peppercorns, green and black cardamoms, whole cumin seeds, cloves, star anise, ginger-garlic paste, Indian bay leaves, salt, some dried red chilies... fry until the onions are translucent, then dump in some long-grain basmati rice (rinse and soak while prepping everything else), and close the lid! Clean the kitchen while the pressure cooker does its magic. When it beeps, top with cilantro and enjoy! Add a bag of frozen veggies for a yummy change of pace. If you are okay with non-veg, substitute 50% chicken broth with 50% water. DELICIOUS
customer_reviews.author: Brian H Estep

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 6 months again, and now it will not turn on.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for 6 months. I use it about once a week and have loved it!! Only problem is I went to use it today, and it will not turn on. I’ve googled tips and tricks to see if there’s something I should know, nothing is working. For the cost it should work longer than 6 months. I’ve tried to see if there is a way to contact the company, but since it’s past the eligible return there is no information on how to contact them.
customer_reviews.author: Trev

customer_reviews.title: This really works.
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled and wheelchair bound. As such sitting up for long periods is often difficult for me. In addition you sit much lower in a wheelchair and can't see using a regular stove. Because of these things I have a lot of kitchen appliances. They take up a lot of room and frequently don't work all that efficiently. This product does multiple functions and does them well. I have tried different foods using different functions all of which have worked fast and well. I have not tried the cake but may do so. I purchased the 6 quart LUX version which is plenty big enough, does anything I can imagine doing, does it well and for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: GRP

customer_reviews.title: Bad Marriage
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on December 1, 2017 Use it maybe 6 or 7 times a year Worked OK for first 6 months Longer I have it, the more I hate it. Replaced silicone ring, still won't seal. It is a battle to get this to work. Grew up in a family where L A R G E pressure cooker was used frequently.. Don't feel totally safe around this pressure cooker. Also,, not the easiest thing to clean - the designers should try cleaning it before marketing it. Think twice before buying - wish i did.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K. & Happy Grandpup

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I've heard people talk about these for a long time and finally broke down and bought one. Im pretty impressed how fast it cooks things. It does take a little longer than you think at first because, for instance, i made some frozen veggies and it said to cook for 1 minute. Yeah, it cooks in one minute once it reaches pressure and temp, but that can take 10 minutes to get there. Regardless, the veggies taste way better than microwave. I also made ribs and they were by far the most tender ribs i've made, but i still gotta work on the flavor on those.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Instant Pot Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This instant Pot Lux was really good. But, in a few days after buy, I was trying to do soup and the appliance just didn’t turn on, dead! I’ve tried a couple times again and it’s totally out of order. I call to Instant Pot customer services and they call for pictures of the appliance. I sent a month ago and they didn’t returno even my email. I sent more requests emails and nothing... Really sad with Instant Pot customer services! Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model for my sister for Christmas. I have the original one from 2015 in my arsenal. I have no negative things to say about the Instant Pot. I love it. I've been part of the cult since 2015 and I'm trying to spread the love, one gift at a time. My brother in law says they like it. I got the 3qt one for my mother and she loves it. Go get one. These aren't the pressure cookers of yore, with the loud, clattering pressure knobs and the very real threat of explosion if you don't cool it down properly. I remember running when my mom would set it down in the sink. Instant Pot is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Am Azon Woman

customer_reviews.title: Vital part missing when it arrived
customer_reviews.text: The instant pot arrived missing the float valve, so it’s unusable.
customer_reviews.author: B. Stahl

customer_reviews.title: BEST!!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this item. This is the best instant pot I have ever had in my life. I changed my diet to a vegetarian-based diet and this pot helps me a lot with the grains. Rice is my favorite. It takes only a few minutes to cook. Lentils my second favourite takes less than 15 min to cook it fully. The only drawback was the slow cooker mode. When I use it, it does not cook the beans fully over 12hr. Definitely, if you are looking for a slow cooker this is not the one!
customer_reviews.author: batuhan

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Healthy Meal Prep for Compact Space
customer_reviews.text: I hate cooking. Cooking creates chaos per the Third Law of Thermodynamics. I like order. But...take-out is usually unhealthy and financially wasteful. Instapot creates minimal chaos and is financially conservative. Instapot is easy to use, and easy to clean. Definitely buy an extra seal ring for savory and sweet recipes. I live in a minimalistic space. With Instapot, I can “cook” without a kitchen when I want something more than a green smoothie or a protein shake.
customer_reviews.author: H. Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: solid and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: all of us are very pleased with this product. saves us lots of time for braises, stews, and steaming while preserving the flavors we expect. some of the other uses for the pot seem a stretch and we'll pass for now..... the only negative is that the plastic ring that seals the pot/lid picks up flavors from the dishes we cook and so far we have been completely unable to neutralize the smells with many varied methods. that being said, we can live with it and it's only a minor flaw.
customer_reviews.author: wandering gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Instant Pot Heaven!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you've never used an Instant Pot, you will fall in love quickly! The other half and I both have made some pretty quick and amazing recipes in it! Ribs, hard boiled eggs, burrito bowls, just to name a few! You can find recipes online, get cookbooks for the Instant Pot or make some of your own favorite comfort meals in this, in about a third the time it takes to cook the traditional way! If you're on the fence, save some counter space and get rid of the rice steamer, crock pot, sauté pan, etc. All you need is this! It's very easy to use, and cleaning it is a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha Butler

customer_reviews.title: I will say it worked like I dream to start but now just after the ...
customer_reviews.text: I was SO excited and ready to use this pressure cooker on a daily basis. I will say it worked like I dream to start but now just after the return policy (around 2 months old) it won't pressurize sometimes and then other times it'll be up to pressure but the timer won't star for a LONG time after it's sealed... So bummed and can't send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kailyn Olson

customer_reviews.title: So far i'm very happy
customer_reviews.text: I've used this instant pot 3 times so far since I got it. Best thing I bought so far. Cooks very fast and the food taste so much better. I like how I can come home from work at 5, prep the night before and food be done roughly 30 mins. Love the fact that I comes with a recipe book as well as an instant pot app easy to use. Definitely recommend this to everyone. I've been blogging about it to all of my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Pratts

customer_reviews.title: I use this at least weekly
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a month now - I use it to make chicken and rice for our pup - Rice comes out sticky. Rice cooker or stovetop is still a much better way to cook rice. Made a pot roast, saute setting worked great. Steamed veggies - super easy. So far, I'm very satisfied with it. When I've tried cooking one pot meals - they all come out with the same texture. Think I need to refine the recipes.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: GREAT gift but Not for college...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be good for my daughter as she heads off to college but I don't think they are allowed in dorms - which makes sense - I didn't think that through! BUT - LOVE this thing - she (18) and her boyfriend have been trying our recipes - amazing how fast it works. I would warn people that you STILL HAVE TO PREP THE FOOD!! So don't think it will cut up meat for you magically but cook time is amazing and the food comes out great - this should be a chicken breast cooking secret - shredded chicken is amazing...
customer_reviews.author: L&N's Mommie

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my crock pot died last fall. I had no idea how much I would be using it. WOW! I use it so much I'm actually considering buying a second instant pot. Not only have I made dinners that my family LOVE, I've also made hard boiled eggs (the shells just fall off.), cheesecakes and banana bread, and I've just scratched the surface. I use it multiple times a week, sometimes multiple times a day. I think the only thing I would change is there is no pressure adjustment function. Maybe there is and I just haven't figured it out yet. No matter. I still love this!
customer_reviews.author: Jenni Bush

customer_reviews.title: The Instant Pot makes cooking safe, fast, and fun!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a Christmas gift for my 13 year old daughter. It's a great age to start learning how to cook. Great products such as the Instant Pot makes cooking safe, fast, and fun. She has tried a variety of recipes from simple to complex preps and even desserts. A great introduction to cooking safety. Highly recommended for ALL ages (13+). It has been great having another cook in the family. And I must admit, I enjoy an occasional break from cooking. She will be properly prepared for adulthood.
customer_reviews.author: Coble Family

customer_reviews.title: Heats up but doesn't pressure cook
customer_reviews.text: I bought one, love it, so bought another for our cabin. It's slightly different and it doesn't work. There isn't a pressure cook button and can't adjust the heat level, button doesn't work. It's useless and I cannot return.
customer_reviews.author: Gail A

customer_reviews.title: What did I do without this?
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this machine! I have not used all the functions yet but the steamer, slow cooker and pressure cooker functions are amazing. I am planning on making an oreo cheesecake and have already purchased a springform pan to fit inside. I have found it is easy to clean and store. The instructions that are included are easy to read and understand. I was a little intimidated at first but love how easy it is to use. There are tons of recipes on the internet for Instant Pot. I'll never run out of things to make.
customer_reviews.author: Mishele J.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Use this several times a week and bought one for my partners 80 year old dad who uses it pretty frequently too. Only issue we’ve had is the smell of spices that gets stuck in the lid. I haven’t looked for a solution so maybe I’m doing something wrong. If I cook something with cumin, curry or chili powder, the smell just sticks around in the lid. Not a huge deal because it doesn’t transfer to the taste of the next dish - just weird when you’re cooking oatmeal and smelling curry... haha
customer_reviews.author: Andrew McCright

customer_reviews.title: The stainless steel pot is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I will never have to worry about a non-stick coating flaking off in my food. I made pot roast yesterday and it was great! Easy to use. A great plus is that I ordered the silicone lid and it does great in the refrigerator. Some reviews said the lid didn't work, but it fit perfectly. The pan has grids on the bottom and I was able to reheat it in the same pan, on the stove. My old pressure cooker and crock pot are leaving the house---don't need them anymore!
customer_reviews.author: jabrnbsn

customer_reviews.title: Daughter inlaw loves this pot
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a Christmas gift to a daughter inlaw. After using it for a couple of weeks she declared that she LOVES IT! I asked about the clean up, and she said it's so simple, and easy to clean. She thinks she'll be using it several days a week. She's hooked! She's so hooked on how well this Instant Pot works that she's joined a Instant Pot recipe club! So, even though I don't personally own one of these pots (love my cast iron cookwares), I can tell you that my daughter inlaw is simply thrilled with hers.
customer_reviews.author: GrannyMJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product, instructions on how to use it were confusing for me though.
customer_reviews.text: Works great but instructions given are confusing, we had to watch videos on YouTube to figure it out. But we never used anything like this so that's probably why. If the instructions were more clear then I'd give 5 stars. But once the learning curve is over, this is a great cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Amazing & Quick !!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quick cooking of pinto beans and so soft!! Am loving this pot!! Have a couple of friends and family recommend this pot and I am happy I purchased it!!
customer_reviews.author: Efrosinia Rosie Burkoff

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: Kept hearing about Instant Pots and finally decided to buy one when it was a good price. Love it. A little scary to use the first time ensuring the lid is on--I guess it won't even come to temp if the lid's not on right--but I'm used to it now and love the way it works. The only down side is that I thought it would be a quick cooking option, but I find all the waiting to get to temp and then the waiting for it to depressurize makes it take longer than it states. Still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Terryh

customer_reviews.title: Ok but had some concerns
customer_reviews.text: I know this has high reviews but I had two concerns so far. The vent that should seal remains open unless I jiggle it once the pressure is sufficient. I may end up returning it for this factor alone. I don’t know if it’s a defect or not. I also think the display is less informative than it should be or could be. Perhaps the next step up gives you more information. Right now once you select an option it just says on until he attends proper heat. Seems like some kind of reminder how many minutes you said four would be useful
customer_reviews.author: M. Rich

customer_reviews.title: Customer service will not help
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working within a month. Called customer service. Still on the line now for 1 hour and 30 min. Customer service is horrible!!
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great for cooking beans
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot. I first cooked some Garbanzo beans. You put 2 cups (soaked) Garb. beans and 1 cup water. Put the time to 25 minutes. Wait about 10 min for nat release and boom - freshly cooked beans. They tasted way better than the can. The hummus I made with them was awesome. I love that I just set the time and can go do other stuff. I feel like if I got the stovetop type it wouldn't be so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Oakton_Va

customer_reviews.title: A Life Changer
customer_reviews.text: The instant pot was a life changer for me. I absolutely disliked cooking chicken because I never really trusted it was done even with use of a food thermometer. I’d buy rotisserie chicken from grocery stores or just order it. With the instant pot, I’ve been able to cook chicken without issue and know it’s done. I’ve also learned how to cook cod in it and can’t wait to find more recipes to make. Great investment. I’m satisfied with my purchase and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Instapot stopped working after 7 mos.
customer_reviews.text: My instapot has worked ok since I got it in Jan. 2118. Today it stopped sealing. I tried the troubleshooting and it didn't work. I then tried to send my complaint to customer service and it would not let me submit my complaint. Very bad customer service. Loved the product until today.
customer_reviews.author: uberdawgmeister

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces, box had been opened
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother for Christmas since I love the one I have. When she opened it, there was no instruction manual, the plastic had been opened and one of the plastic spoons was missing. Looks as if someone had it before is and returned it for some reason. Without the instructions she had to call me every time she used it for the first couple of months because she could not make it work. The Instant Pot itself works fine, but the fact that the box had been opened and pieces were missing was SO not cool.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Instant Pot...Instant Like
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other brand names, Instant Pot is a steal. Bought this based on a recommendation from a friend to replace a 25 year-old dedicated rice cooker that can also make a few other things like porridge, sweet rice, etc. This cooker is very good quality and it takes no time to cook under pressure. Cooking rice is a fast 10-minute job compared to 30 minutes with the existing rice cooker. Very happy with this product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: i2i

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars isn't enough!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Instant Pot. Takes a little reading to learn to use it, and I wouldn't cook anything without getting cook/rest times from a recipe, but it has completely changed how and what I cook - chowders, roasts, chicken... anything you want! Fluffy baked potatoes in 12 minutes. Chicken thighs in 6 minutes. Chowder in 12 minutes. Of course, all require prep time, as well as "wait time" as pressure subsides and your goodies continue to cook. Well worth the money, easy to clean, and many great features.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Wescott

customer_reviews.title: What took me so long to buy one of these????
customer_reviews.text: I haven't stopped using my instant pot since day one. In fact, I bought two more for gifts. Soups, beef roasts, chicken, potatoes, etc etc etc.....all of it, done in so much less time. Endless recipes to try. It was intimidating at first but from talking to friends and going online, there's always someone out there who can walk you and talk you through.
customer_reviews.author: Sonis

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use, hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised how many good ratings this product has. The cooker arrived and I followed the instruction to make rice, steam and water were all over the cover surface, there’s no side handles, and the covers stays hot at lease 5 mins after cooking. The cover is so HOT, that you CAN NOT touch it, Sorry for the bad review but it really is a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Liu

customer_reviews.title: Really powerful/works well, just mind the release valve!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this cuts down cooking time in the kitchen! Just be VERY careful when releasing the steam pressure from the float valve! We have not had any accidents because we read the multiple warnings and instruction manual right away. There is some heating up time before the pressure cooling starts, so be aware of that. For example-cooking a butternut squash is 7 minutes, but that isn’t counting a few minutes to build up the heat/steam in the chamber, and the time after to release the steam from the chamber. So, it ends up being like 10 minutes or so, not just the 7 minutes of pressure cooking time. Other than that, enjoy! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Grrrrrlll!!!

customer_reviews.title: This has revolutionized my cooking!
customer_reviews.text: I am a busy working mom who strives to get a hot, healthy dinner on the table quickly for my family of four every night. This instant pot is an immense help to me! The 6 quart is a great size. I have doubled some recipes for leftovers and stayed under the max fill line. I recommend also purchasing an accessory set and some good cookbooks (I highly recommend the Instant Pot Bible) and have the confidence to experiment. Everything I have made tastes flavorful, fresh, with a wonderful texture. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh A. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I've just received this item yesterday, so I didn't have the chance to use it yet. The item has arrived in perfect condition, and with all the advertised accessories . Love the inside/out stainless steel material. Seems very sturdy. Pictures to come as soon as I use it ;-). Very happy so far with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: FANE

product_meta.title: Instant Pot Lux 6-in-1 Electric Pressure Cooker, Sterilizer Slow Cooker, Rice Cooker, Steamer, Saute, and Warmer, 6 Quart, 12 One-Touch Programs
product_meta.description: Size:6 QuartInstant Pot is a smart multi-use Electric Pressure Cooker designed with the objective of being Convenient, Dependable and Safe. It speeds up cooking by 2-6 times making it extremely energy-efficient, while, preserving nutrients and preparing healthy, tasty dishes. Instant Pot Lux V3 6 In 1 Programmable multi-cooker replaces 6 kitchen appliances, it combines the functions of a Pressure Cooker, Slow Cooker, Rice Cooker, saute, Steamer, and Warmer. 12 smart built-in programs – Soup/Broth, Meat/Stew, Cake, Egg, saute, Rice, Multigrain, Steam, Porridge, Pressure Cook, Keep Warm and Slow Cook, your favourite dishes are as easy as pressing a button. The new Cake Maker is ideal for New York style cheesecake, banana bread and other moist cakes, the Egg Program prepares, soft, medium and hard-boiled eggs perfectly in just a few minutes. Built with the latest 3rd generation technology with an embedded microprocessor. During cooking the microprocessor monitors pressure, temperature, keeps time, and adjusts heating intensity and duration. Even the volume of food is taken into consideration, all greatly improving cooking results and consistency of the dishes. A 24-hour delay start timer for delayed cooking. Automatic keep warm holds the temperature of the dish until you serve. The fully sealed environment traps the flavours, nutrients and aromas within the food without heating up the kitchen. The 3-ply inner pot stainless steel bottom is extremely durable and leaves no health concerns as associated with non-stick coatings. Bushed stainless steel exterior is finger print resistant with a large, clear display panel. UL certified, carefully designed with 10 proven safety mechanisms to eliminate many common errors that could cause harm or spoil food providing you uncompromised assurance. Instant Pot is the ideal kitchen appliance for your faced-paced, healthy lifestyle. Power Supply Cord: 33 inches, non-detached, 2 prong plug. Power supply: 120V – 60Hz.
feature_bullets: Cooks fast & saves time: The Instant Pot Duo Multi-Cooker combines 6 Appliances in one: pressure cooker, slow cooker, rice cooker, steamer and warmer – and cooks up to 70% faster
Consistently delicious: 12 one-touch smart programs put cooking ribs, soups, beans, rice, poultry, desserts and more on autopilot – with tasty results
Easy to clean: Fingerprint-resistant stainless steel lid and components and accessories are dishwasher safe
Advanced safety protection: The 10+ built-in safety features, including overheat protection, safety lock and more to ensure safe pressure cooking.
Accessories included: Stainless steel steam rack with handles, rice paddle, soup spoon, measuring cup and condensation collector

Plenty of recipes: Free Instant Pot app on iOS and Android devices is, loaded with hundreds of recipes for any cuisine to get you started on your culinary adventure. Millions of users provide support and guidance in the many Instant Pot online communities
Most popular size capacity: 6-quart large capacity cooks for up to 6 people – perfect for families, and also great for meal prepping and batch cooking for singles and smaller households
Stainless steel inner pot: The instant pot stainless steel inner pot is made with a 3-ply bottom for durability and is healthy and dishwasher-safe

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars11,420 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
